bool JSON::ExtractString ( const char **  data,
std::string &  str 
) [static, protected]

Extracts a JSON String as defined by the spec - "<some chars>" Any escaped characters are swapped out for their unescaped values

protected

Parameters:
char**data Pointer to a char* that contains the JSON text
std::string&str Reference to a std::string to receive the extracted string
Returns:
bool Returns true on success, false on failure

Save the char so we can change it if need be

Escaping something?

Move over the escape char

Deal with the escaped char

We need 5 chars (4 hex + the 'u') or its not valid

Deal with the chars

Do it first to move off the 'u' and leave us on the final hex digit as we move on by one later on

Parse the hex digit

Invalid hex digit = invalid JSON

By the spec, only the above cases are allowed

End of the string?

Disallowed char?

SPEC Violation: Allow tabs due to real world cases

Add the next char

Move on

If we're here, the string ended incorrectly

public

Can be white space now and should be at the end of the string then...

We're now at the end of the string
